line_1: Are by a fillip turn'd to birds;
line_2: The cards, obedient to his words,

line_1: Alarm'd cat, monkey, dogs and birds;
line_2: At once the torrent of her words

line_1: The fall of waters and the song of birds,
line_2: And hills that echo to the distant herds,

line_1: Thus Sylvia yielded to the birds,
line_2: Too complaisant to doubt their words;

line_1: 'Tis true, the Music of the Birds,
line_2: But see them pearching on the Trees,

line_1: The blushing fruite to feast invites the birds;
line_2: The temper'd clime full many a tree affords;

line_1: Had fables read of beasts and birds,
line_2: Some reason spoke, and many words;
